newsitem.title: USA: Pease Oil buys East Bayou Sorrel stake.
newsitem.headline: Pease Oil buys East Bayou Sorrel stake.

text.p: Pease Oil and Gas Co said Monday it purchased a 7.8125 percent after prospect payout working interest in the area of mutual interest attached to the East Bayou Sorrel Prospect in Iberville Parish, La.
Pease Oil said the purchase price was valued at $1.75 million dollars with payment consisting of $875,000 cash and the issuance of 315,000 shares of its common.
The company made the purchase from individuals who put the prospect together, a spokesman said.
The purchase includes interest in the deep rights below 11,000 feet under the Bayou Sorrel Field which National Energy Group Inc recently purchased from Panaco Inc.

The prospect contains a discovery well, the C.E. Schwing 1, which was tested in June 1996 at a sustained rate of 1,026 barrels of oil per day and 980,000 cubic feet of natural gas per day from a perforated interval of 13,208 feet to 13,226 feet. The field was put on production in December 1996, and has experienced flow rates similar to those experienced during the test period, Pease Oil said.
